item.title: Audit Data Analytics Part5
item.description: This part covers features selection. Target variable is revenue. Principal Component Analysis (PCA) Quickly running the statistical method suggests that four PCA should be selected as their variance is more than one. PCA model agrees to the above result. PCA1 and PCA2 totally explain 50% of the data. Importance of components: PC1 PC2 PC3 PC4 PC5 PC6 PC7 Standard deviation 1.7685 1.4583 1.2553 1.0853 0.95570 0.86823 0.71936 Proportion of Variance 0.

item.title: Audit Data Analytics Part2
item.description: This part covers audit procedures generally performed on sales and AR accounts. item.title: Audit Data Analytics Part1
item.description: Introduction Accounting professionals tend to work under pressure so that they can cover as much ground as possible. However, tools at their disposal often have very limited power and are unable to optimistically fit their workflow. Furthermore, their work is prone to errors due to too many copy+paste and unreproduciblity. In my view, R is a perfect tool to increases their productivity and conform to their workflow.

item.title: Git for Windows
item.description: Installation; git --version, git config, git help config, git config --global user.name "st", git config --global user.email "st", git config --global --list, git config --list, Local wd -> staging -> remote repo; git init, git status, git add -A, git add ., git add --no-all, git rm --cached <file>, git reset, git commit -m "msg", git log, git log --stat, git remote add origin <link>, git push -u origin master,

item.title: JavaScript MERN Stack
item.description: Vanilla JS Variables Template literals: ${}, +, \n, \, +=, Function scope: var, Primitive values: const, Block {scope}: let, this, null, undefined, symbol, typeof, new String(), split(''), join, substring, substr, trim, padStart (10,'a'), padEnd, replace, concat, Boolean(), new Date(), getFullYear, Math.sqrt, parseInt, toFixed(5), %, %=, parseFloat(svg.attr("height")), new Set([1,1,1,1]), size, add, delete, has, clear, Object Object literal: function maker (city, state){const address = {city: city, state}} Key vs Value: Object.

item.title: Webscraping JSON Data
item.description: req <- 'https://data.gov.sg/dataset/7a339d20-3c57-4b11-a695-9348adfd7614/resource/42ff9cfe-abe5-4b54-beda-c88f9bb438ee/data?limit=6000' df <- fromJSON(req)$records %>% as_tibble() %>% mutate(town = str_to_title(town), flat_type = str_to_title(flat_type), floor_area_sqm = as.numeric(floor_area_sqm), street_name = str_to_title(street_name), resale_price = as.numeric(resale_price), lease_commence_date = as.numeric(lease_commence_date), storey_range = str_to_lower(storey_range), block = paste0("Blk", block)) %>% separate(month, c("year", "month"), sep = "-") %>% mutate(year = as.numeric(year), month = as.numeric(month), desc = paste0(town, "|", block, "|", storey_range, "|", flat_model, "|", flat_type, "|", floor_area_sqm, ":Mth", month)) %>% select(-12) {"

item.title: test post
item.description: You guessed. :) This is a test post. library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages ----------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.2.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.2.0 v purrr 0.3.2 ## v tibble 2.1.3 v dplyr 0.8.1 ## v tidyr 0.8.3 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.3.1 v forcats 0.4.0 ## -- Conflicts -------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() mtcars %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, hp, color = as.factor(gear))) + geom_point(show.
